org.threadly.concurrent

Class AbstractSubmitterExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.AbstractSubmitterExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SubmitterExecutorInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSubmitterScheduler, ExecutorLimiter, ExecutorWrapper, RateLimiterExecutor

    public abstract class AbstractSubmitterExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements SubmitterExecutorInterface

    Since the conversion to a SubmitterExecutorInterface from an executor is often the same (just using the ListenableFutureTask to wrap the task). This class provides an easy way to create a SubmitterExecutorInterface. Take a look at ExecutorWrapper for an easy example of how this is used. In general this wont be useful outside of Threadly developers, but must be a public interface since it is used in sub-packages.

    Since:
    1.3.0

      • submit

        public ListenableFuture<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

      • submit

        public <T> ListenableFuture<T> submit(java.lang.Runnable task,
                             T result)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return the provided result once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of result for future
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        result - result to be returned from resulting future .get() when runnable completes
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

      • submit

        public <T> ListenableFuture<T> submit(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Submit a Callable to run as soon as possible. This is needed when a result needs to be consumed from the callable.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of result returned from the future
        Parameters:
        task - callable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed and get the result of the callable
